description: From Latin glaucus, from Ancient Greek γλαυκός (glaukós, “blue-green, blue-grey”), 1670s. See Irish glas.

adjectives.description: glaucous (comparative more glaucous, superlative most glaucous)

entries.meaning: (color) Of a pale grey or bluish-green, especially when covered with a powdery residue.
(botany) Covered with a bloom or a pale powdery covering, regardless of colour.
